text: the tipping point for me in terms of
wide I love entrepreneurship and I got
involved with entrepreneurship really
started in college my faculty advisor
professor named Roy Jones and I were got
together at the beginning in sophomore
year and he said to me do you want to
start a company and I said that sounds
like a great idea sign me up and so he
introduced me to a fellow classmate of
mine named Jill Lamont and I went mad
Joe and I distinctly remember coming
back to my dorm that day and I said to
my buddies I just met the next Bill
Gates and we went on to start a company
that year we ended up building
enterprise software that we sold to
local businesses up and down el camino
rial and we employed about a dozen of
our classmates to write the code for us
that we would go and sell and it was a
great experience we grew it to a million
in revenue that's what really got me
excited about entrepreneurship that
whole experience in terms of helping
students here at HBS you know part of
what I benefited from during my eight
years of trilogy' down in Austin was
just seeing the process of a software
business go from less than a million in
revenue to three hundred million dollars
over the course of eight years I think
that gives me an opportunity to help
students that are in the formative
stages of thinking through a business
idea going through that process of how
do you really figure out is this a good
idea am i onto the right track is this
something I should spend more time on or
not what are the steps I can take early
on to validate you know my assumptions
to figure out if if this makes sense and
what are some small scale experiments
that I can run in order to figure out
you know does this make sense
